Sentencas: The present study compares the feasibility of controlling the properties of a glass composite seal by adding nano- or micronscale yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) powders to a borate glass used for sealing electrolyte-supported solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Comparison between micrometer- and nano-scale glass composites for sealing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The crystallization of the glass composites was found to be independent of the volume fraction of added YSZ, for both sizes of the additive.
Titulo: Comparison between micrometer- and nano-scale glass composites for sealing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The variation of the flow properties of both composite seals was measured using a wettability test, and an increase of the contact angle was observed when the volume fraction of additives was increased.
Titulo: Comparison between micrometer- and nano-scale glass composites for sealing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The major factor found to decrease spreading of the glass composite was the additive particle size, where shape retention was observed for the nanometer (nm)-YSZ composites while spreading of the micrometer (pm)YSZ composites was observed under the same testing conditions.
Titulo: Comparison between micrometer- and nano-scale glass composites for sealing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Examination of the microstructure showed that initially the Ba-containing glass reacted with YSZ to form a BaZrO3 compound.
Titulo: Comparison between micrometer- and nano-scale glass composites for sealing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Long-time exposure at 800 degrees C caused a large reduction in the coefficient of thermal expansion (CTE), which can be explained by increased formation of BaZrO3 and further change in glass composition.
Titulo: Comparison between micrometer- and nano-scale glass composites for sealing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This change in CTE occurs rapidly for the nm-YSZ composites, which is not observed for the mu m-YSZ composites.
Titulo: Comparison between micrometer- and nano-scale glass composites for sealing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the adverse reactions occurring between the additives and the glass matrix were found to reduce the CTE of the glass composites to a value lower than the recommended limit for a system used for sealing SOFCs.
Titulo: Comparison between micrometer- and nano-scale glass composites for sealing solid oxide fuel cells
